website_summaries.verdict: Connect up to 10 devices at once for phenomenal flexibility.
pros: This sleek, low-profile dock includes 3 USB 3.0 ports, 2 USB 3.0 charging ports, 1 FireWire port, 1 HDMI port, 1 Ethernet port, and 2 3.5-millimeter audio jacks
It also features 2 Thunderbolt ports for daisy chaining
cons: Dock can cause problems by cycling on and off, and often gets very warm

customer_reviews.title: Hard drives & daisy-chained devices periodically disconnected
customer_reviews.text: I really hated having to return this dock. The 5 usb 3 ports were super-fast and sped up my macbook air 2011 HD access considerably. Unfortunately, every 1 or 2 days, it would disconnect the hard drives attached to it as well as my Universal Audio thunderbolt audio device which was daisy-chained off of it. We were unable to find the cause of the problem, and after trying 2 units, had to return them. Sorry to let it go.
customer_reviews.author: Average Dude

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. It's a hit or a miss. Don't be surprised if you get a Dud with a lot of issues. You may or may not luck out.
customer_reviews.text: Complete disappointment. Just do yourself a favor and read the other reviews. This HUB is great that it offers more USB 3.0 ports than most, but it doesn't seem to be able to handle all the ports working at the same time. 1. There is a major heat issue. 2. My screen flickered. 3. Ethernet plug is not reliable. It's terrible actually. 4. Any little movement would cause a connection loss. There needs to be more quality control done before releasing a HUB again. This is a fail.
customer_reviews.author: BookWorm

customer_reviews.title: Returned after had to power cycle to mount attached devices.
customer_reviews.text: Unreliable -- after a few days of use I woke up to find that everything attached was unresponsive. Rebooting my Mac did nothing. I had to power cycle the OWC dock. I was using an Apple store thunderbolt cable -- we really can't do better than that. I'm sad. I liked this dock. I especially liked the Firewire 800 support, now I'll need to buy a firewire adapter and use up a T2 port. I liked the USB3 ports -- even though it's unclear whether or not this has UASP support the throughput on an external UAPS USB 3 SSD was comparable to docks that claim UASP support. Power cycling though -- that's a killer. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: John Faughnan

customer_reviews.title: Ordered THREE Replacements, All Had SERIOUS Issues
customer_reviews.text: If you search the reviews here and elsewhere you will discover many reports of intermittent issues with disconnects of attached storage, failure to wake up from sleep, and rapid performance degradation issues (e.g. after a couple months it dies). For me there was no other product with the features so I told myself those reviews were outliers with random product defects. After THREE replacements I can now say with absolute certainty that this product has serious and profound manufacturing defects which are not avoidable. These issues result in frozen connections to peripherals, brutal system crashes resulting in lost data, and random disconnects of external storage. Avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: alberto balsalm

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it didn't
customer_reviews.text: edit* talked to customer service about a refund they told me that the item has a shelf life and will in fact fail at some point and they cant give me a refund .. which i find to be ridiculous Worked great but then it won't connect to either of my macs with 2 different thunderbolt cables so you know it's the device.. I tried the keep it awake trick I tried and app to keep the drives awake I tried resetting the pram nothing works it's gonna end up currupting my drives which is bill due to it being so expensive
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R. Graham

customer_reviews.title: OWC used to be a good company with good products (like hard drive enclosures)
customer_reviews.text: This hub has been disconnecting hard drives me since I got it a few months ago. I thought maybe it was something else, maybe my laptop trying to sleep or something. Nope. It now disconnects hard drives every few minutes. I've been on chat hold with OWC for 10 minutes, waiting to see if they'll give me another. OWC used to be a good company with good products (like hard drive enclosures). This is very unacceptable for a $200 item.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, until it didn't
customer_reviews.text: I had this dock for about 1.5 years and it did everything it was supposed to. Then one day, the ethernet port stopped working, then the USB ports and finally the pass through thunderbolt cable. I called OWC to tech it and we determined it was a dud, just beyond the warranty coverage. This is really unfortunate because now that I have to replace it I'm hesitant to buy another. I think for the money I should have gotten more than 1.5 year out of the thing. Just my two cents.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Waste of $200
customer_reviews.text: Waste of $200. Serves me right for ignoring the other reviews. I only ignored them because I have owned many OWC products in my life and they have always been very high quality. Not this brick. I am so frustrated with this docking station, I will never own another OWC product again. First the sound stopped working. Then I had to constantly reboot for the monitor to work. Like others have mentioned, problems are "time released" so you get happy at the start thinking it works...and then FAIL. Enjoy your cute looking brick. My only goal with this review is to save one person from making the same mistake I did. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Dittberner

customer_reviews.title: Fw800 peer to peer
customer_reviews.text: Brought unit primarily for fw800 port...does not connect all firewire devices....will perform basic external harddrive function via fw....but not recognize audio interface devices regardless of software
customer_reviews.author: Mike Steele

customer_reviews.title: Does not support dual monitors unless you have a native ...
customer_reviews.text: Does not support dual monitors unless you have a native thunder bolt monitor. SO for 99% of monitors out there, you CAN'T do dual monitors which is why I bought this dock. Otherwise, it does a great job of combining all your connections down to a single thunderbolt connection. It looks nice and appears well built, but unfortunately the lack of dual HDMI or DVI support is a deal breaker for me.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Use a high quality thunderbolt cable!!!
customer_reviews.text: Within a week after purchasing the dock, I had a problem with audio cutting out randomly; at least once per day. I read some reviews here and saw that some others were having an identical or similar issue. On a hunch, I decided to purchase a genuine Apple Thunderbolt cable. Poof! Problem solved. No audio problems since. The (faulty)cable I purchased with the dock was manufactured by StarTech. The cable I replaced it with is a genuine Apple Thunderbolt cable I picked up at the Apple Store.
customer_reviews.author: JasonB.

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects devices at random
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hook up my MBP to a bunch of peripherals. After about 30-45 min of use, all peripherals (hard drives) would disconnect simultaneously and I would have to connect the entire Thunderbolt 2 dock again just to get them connected. All software was updated on my Mac and I was running OS X El Capitan. Returned it after a few days of the same disconnect happening over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: HY

customer_reviews.title: AVOID: The right features but still not reliable
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this dock but it intermittently drops connection with my monitor. While a reboot will usually fix the problem it is very frustrating trying to reboot a headless Mac Pro (I have to keep my iPad with VNC handy!). OWC support has been less than helpful. Despite having the same issue on two computers they won't repair or replace the item. I used to recommend OWC to friends. Now I just hope no one I've sent their way has had an experience like mine.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: Expensive brick, doesn't last.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE (1 star, 3 years after purchase): After a couple months, the power supply stopped working. I replaced the power supply with a similar model and continued to use the dock without issue. That is until this week, when the dock quit functioning altogether. It's just an expensive brick now. I'd not recommend this unit to anyone. ORIGINAL (4 stars, one month after purchase): My only complaint is that cables coming out the rear make it tip backwards if unsupported. This is simply because it's lightweight and can't hold itself firm on the desk with heavy cables in the back. This is quickly remedied with some cable ties. Very clean look, and works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Schnautz

customer_reviews.title: and was beautiful after removal of the protective film)
customer_reviews.text: This expensive product is doing what I hoped it would do and is doing it very well. So, I can't complain. But, I had to return the first delivery because the top surface did not have a protective plastic film and was all scratched up (the bottom did, and was beautiful after removal of the protective film). Well, the second Dock arrived with the same issue! Top all scratched up again. I tried communicating, but not a peep from seller. I gave up hoping for a product in good cosmetic condition. I can't give it more than okay rating for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: David B Englund

customer_reviews.title: Caused my MBP to crash. Not cool.
customer_reviews.text: Trying to drive two monitors from this device failed (HDMI + thunderbolt-to-DVI). The device itself got VERY hot. Sound shows up as some sort of generic USB sound. Video on the external monitors was a little odd. After sleep one would take 10 seconds to come ack to life. But the killer was that my MBP (2015 15") crashed multiple times when this was connected. Removed it and re-plugged everything into the MBP directly and all was good. Back to Amazon it went. Once I get over the trauma of my MBP crashing I may try other brands of dock.
customer_reviews.author: R. Philip

customer_reviews.title: It's a very good dock, nicely designed
customer_reviews.text: It's a very good dock, nicely designed, has plenty of ports and is heavy enough that I haven't had to tape it down. Docking a laptop is actually practical. If you spring for usb video adapters, or have thunderbolt displays, you can drive several displays with this, as well as your keyboard and mouse. My only complaint is that while the idea that the dock should always be on makes sense, some devices don't always play nice with it when left plugged in overnight. While a power button is probably overkill, some way to reset connected devices would be helpful short of unplugging and plugging them in again.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: This dock only lasted 8 months...but they replaced it free.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this when I first got it. But 8 months later is has completely stopped working. I have tried to get anything to boot or work on both my iMac desktop and my MacBook Pro through this dock, but nada. It started failing last month when peripherals wouldn't mount on the desktop. For the pricetag of $250 this thing should have lasted MUCH longer. I'm very disapppointed. RE-REVIEW: they replaced it for free and it has worked fine for the past two years.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Wish it worked, but it is junk.
customer_reviews.text: What an annoyance. I had the first one replaced for the problems described here. The problem is loss of signal to the host system. I initially began to experience loss of monitor signal from the hdmi port, upon closer examination all throughput from the dock intermittently drops connection. This includes hdmi, ethernet, firewire, usb.. everything. I can only speculate that it is a power related problem. I had the unit replaced once and now the same problems have manifested again. Tested both units with separate computers, monitors and cables; same result. OWC tech support insists it is impossible to have the issues I was describing, but they did kindly take the unit back.
customer_reviews.author: lotophagi

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately, dock keeps disconnecting intermittently. Not sure what ...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, dock keeps disconnecting intermittently. Not sure what the issue is, but unfortunately my warranty has expired. Some months it worked out well... but lately it's just gotten finicky to the point of being completely unusable. Wish there was a way to return and switch the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Von Wong

customer_reviews.title: The device lasted exactly 18 months and is basically useless to me now
customer_reviews.text: This started as a 5-star purchase until all of the USB ports died. The device lasted exactly 18 months and is basically useless to me now.
customer_reviews.author: MelRay

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid
customer_reviews.text: I think this is fantastic. Not sure why the reviews are so mixed. I'm using with a late 2013 Mac Book Pro. I use it to connect to a 27" Dell monitor via HDMI, Ethernet, audio-out for speakers, a few USB peripherals. I've never had any sleep wake issues. I've never had to unplug it for any reason. I zip tied a Thunderbolt cable to a power cable to replicate the cleanliness of a single cable like the Apple Thunderbolt Display.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Works for me good tech support
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly with my MacBook Air 2014. I use it for dual monitors and no issues with that. Have been using it for a month and no issues so far. I had to contact tech support when I was setting it up and they were great and responsive. The only negative is that sound quality is not so good when you are using doc inputs/output for voice and audio.
customer_reviews.author: Joshiji

customer_reviews.title: Does not work at all in Win7 under Boot Camp.
customer_reviews.text: It works great with Mac OS X El Capitan and works great running with Parallels running Win7, however, does not work at all if you run Win7 under Boot Camp... that really is bad news for me for I need to run both MacOSX & Win7. Have no choice but to return to Amazon. I should have done my homework.
customer_reviews.author: A. Suarez

customer_reviews.title: A safe buy
customer_reviews.text: True, this is one of more (if not the most) expensive thunderbolt 2 port expander, but damn. It rocks! Has a small issue, regarding Apple USB keyboard, Super Drive and iPad charging on the USB ports - but it is fixable with the kext update from their website. The only issue here is that they should mention this on the box with a sticker maybe? or a leaflet inside the box. But certainly not a show stopper. I have it paired with the Dell P2415Q (4K 24") and the vertical Henge Dock - which makes it so easy to connect and disconnect.
customer_reviews.author: Shahar

customer_reviews.title: This Thunderbolt dock is great - I have an Asus ROG with windows 8
customer_reviews.text: This Thunderbolt dock is great - I have an Asus ROG with windows 8.1 and a thunderbolt dock. When I went to the Asus site the driver still didn't work for this. Then I found a link for a recent Intel driver that works!  Now I love this dock. It is actually designed for Apple computers well with 8.1 USB 3.0 keeps cutting out. With this dock no more problems.
customer_reviews.author: L. G OHara

customer_reviews.title: There appear to be relatively few Thunderbolt 2 docks out there.
customer_reviews.text: It works just fine. It was a bit expensive however.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Cote

customer_reviews.title: It didn't work at all.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what happened here. A) The product was CLEARLY not new, it was used (tons of scratches and wear and tear on the black surface) and B) It didnt work at all. I connected it to the Mac and the Mac just blinked a few times but the devices attached were not recognized. I am not down on OWC (I would like to try a new one).
customer_reviews.author: cocoperu

customer_reviews.title: Monitor disconnects make this useless
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased six of these for my firm. Of the six, three have serious monitor disconnect issues. They are not useful to us; we are researching alternatives from other firms. If you plan to connect other Thunderbolt devices to this dock, I would buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: D. McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Total waste of time money!! Doesn’t do what is advertised!! APPLE TOTALLY SCREWED OWC OUT OF WHAT COULD/ WAS A GOOD THING!!
customer_reviews.author: RTS-LUV

customer_reviews.title: Great addition for mac laptops with some limitations
customer_reviews.text: works well and saves hooking up a few cables every time bring my laptop back to my desk. In the end you run out of ports just like before! Would be nice if you could run two monitors from one thunderbolt cable but hooking up one HDMI and one thunderbolt isn't the end of the world. its great to have a firewire 800 port for those legacy drives
customer_reviews.author: B. Emerson

customer_reviews.title: OWC Thunderbolt 2 Dock Supports Several USB-3 Peripherals + a Display + an Attached iPad on my Mac Mini (2012)
customer_reviews.text: This OWC Thunderbolt 2 Dock effectively supports my 2 additional USB-3 disk drives and powers an attached iPad, while powering an HDMI (non-Apple) display for my Mac Mini (2012). I had to locate and download an updated driver, in order to deliver enough power to my attached iPad, but it's otherwise functioned, well.
customer_reviews.author: IlDavo

customer_reviews.title: It must have been a loose connection because it works fine now. Great amount of USB ports
customer_reviews.text: The unit did not seem to function properly at first; it would randomly restart when touched. It must have been a loose connection because it works fine now. Great amount of USB ports, I like that the lights are on the bottom so they are only seen when you need to know it is responding. I like this thing very much.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: You're better off plugging and unplugging a bunch of stuff rather ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this. I had nothing but issues while having two displays (one being a thunderbolt display) connected. It finally just stopped outputting to two screens. You're better off plugging and unplugging a bunch of stuff rather than throw away $200 and deal with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Keeley F Carrigan

customer_reviews.title: Does not have a thunderbolt cable
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievably, for such an expensive item it does not contain what it is needed to make it work. A thunderbolt cable!
customer_reviews.author: dmnieto

customer_reviews.title: Would love if it could do dual displays directly off the ...
customer_reviews.text: For those on actively managed networks, this device requires a thorough setup as it has it's own mac address, etc. Using in a normal office environment alongside an 2015 MBP. It does everything I need it too. Would love if it could do dual displays directly off the dock, but without a thunderbolt display, you have to drive your second display separately. Great product for a solid price. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Cmac

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Not cheap, but works well. I needed more reliable USB ports, and these have not let me down once like the several other USB expansion boxes I have bought. Surprisingly, I needed a Firewire interface a month after buying this, so that "unneeded" feature really came in handy.
customer_reviews.author: BDMSB

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: My monitor doesn't work when it is plugged into it, and when I connect an external drive it sends error messages that it has been ejected improperly. I had to disconnect it all so that I could be up and running again. Wish I returned this in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: Sara J

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the units selling now have a better firmware. Also, don't think of utilizing a non Apple Lightening cable
customer_reviews.text: Found that it is best NOT TO USE this for external drives. So I must use for cameras, microphones, WACOM PAD, light, and other USB DEVICES,
customer_reviews.author: Kohala Dave

customer_reviews.title: The connection between your Macbook Air and desktop I have been looking for in a simple package.
customer_reviews.text: I looked at several docks for my macbook air. None offered the number of ports or the connivence that this product appeared to have from the description. I received the dock quickly and I plugged it in and within one minute my macbook figured out all the connections and starting running. There are several things I hope to do with it in the near future. I would recommend it to anyone wanting to have quick connection to desktop and portability of the laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Brooks B. Allshouse

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: This device lasted from Jan. '18 till today. The USB ports just quit working. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought this, cleans up appearance of laptop on desk and eliminates the hassle of plugging in all those cords. Unit runs hot and bottom has very little clearance from desk, so I found it useful to put some stick-on bumpers underneath to increase clearance. But otherwise a great product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Randall

customer_reviews.title: Started out great - running into issues.
customer_reviews.text: For the past few months I would have given this dock 5 Stars no questions asked. After using it during office hours it's recently started to overheat and cause my external monitor (connected via Thunderbolt) to flicker throughout the day as well as lose connection to external drives hooked up. If it continues I will be requesting a warranty replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Phelps

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! Going on just under a week of usage
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Going on just under a week of usage. Everything worked right out of the box. The only thing I wish this thing did (which I doubt any dock does) is power from the thunderbolt, or better yet, combine a cable that will plug into both so I don't have to have two laptop power cords. Running an external monitor, wired keyboard, wired mouse, speaker setup and external drives.
customer_reviews.author: jmackey

customer_reviews.title: I have 2 docks. 8 HDs connected to my ...
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 docks. 8 HDs connected to my MacBook Pro plus second monitor. It is the way to go!!!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Imagine how annoying that is
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months, this is no longer able to sustain a stable connection. My peripherals would disconnect for 10 seconds at a time, once every several minutes. Imagine how annoying that is.
customer_reviews.author: Q. Wang

customer_reviews.title: USB, Thunderbolt, and Firewire.
customer_reviews.text: A great way to get ports up front for an iMac. This gives me all the ports I need up front. It's expensive, but it was one of the only solutions I found that would get me USB, Thunderbolt, and Firewire ports.
customer_reviews.author: Teton Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Dock
customer_reviews.text: Unable to use dual monitors unless you use a True Apple Thunderbolt monitor even though the dock has an HDMI and a Mini Display port you can not connect 2 monitors using those ports.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Worked great out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: Worked properly right out of the box. I use it with a macbook pro with only the thunderbolt cable going to the dock. The dock has usb keyboard & 2 drives, ethernet, firewire & hdmi display plugged in. All play well together
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Ports were what I needed, but not useable
customer_reviews.text: Product caused devices, display to randomly disconnect, screens would flicker. SD card would randomly eject while plugged in. Returned it and am using a USB 3 adapter and just plugging the monitor cable in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Working well with Mac Book Pro under OSX and 8.1/Bootcamp.
customer_reviews.text: Well made, attractive, working well with Mac Book Pro under OSX and 8.1/Bootcamp. The only thing I don't like is the shiny black plastic. Wish is was all silver and maybe a little bit smaller. All in all very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Yuichiro Nagai

customer_reviews.title: it does what i bought it for!
customer_reviews.text: great buy! i love the fact it has the Firewire 800 it works like a beaut! I will definitely update should issues arise. works great for turning my MB pro in to a desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Spoony

customer_reviews.title: Not Enough Devices?
customer_reviews.text: OWC Thunderbolt 2 Dock is a must for professionals and the home user.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Works super well. Had to move from a thinkpad with ...
customer_reviews.text: Works super well. Had to move from a thinkpad with a real docking station to a Mac recently. This alleviated some of the transition pains. Probably worth mentioning it doesn't come with a thunderbolt cable, and it's obviously worthless without one.
customer_reviews.author: cm

customer_reviews.title: Probably a handy expansion dock for older MacBooks.
customer_reviews.text: I personally can't say I appreciated any better performance using this usb3 drives so opted to return it to get a proper thunderbolt drive dock instead
customer_reviews.author: I. Clements

customer_reviews.title: Did not work.
customer_reviews.text: Product does not work. Even tried downloading from the OWC website. At this price I expect it to work in a "plug-n-play" fashion, not requiring fidgeting and searching for answers. Returned it within 24 hours
customer_reviews.author: SalSol

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it with my Macbook Pro. Thunderbolt connection is solid. One thunderbolt in, and one out.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: This really helped make my Macbook Pro into a Desktop computer - 3 monitor screens
customer_reviews.text: I have a macbook pro, late 2011 model and wanted to really utilize it as a desktop machine as it got older. This dock was the answer to so many of my issues with the limitations my old macbook had as a laptop. I can now run 2 extra 24" monitors to extend my desktop across 3 screens with ease due to having USB 3.0 ports and a USB 3.0 to DVI adapter. Everything just runs so much faster and even in my windows OS through parallels runs smooth. The box is a little pricey, but worth every penny. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: kiliki

customer_reviews.title: Good, but has some bad habits
customer_reviews.text: I brought this as a dock for my MBP 2015 In all it works well, however it is prone to crashing from time to time which is just a pain in the butt. The other thing i noticed is that when the speakers are plugged into it they make a pop sound every now and then which is almost like its from a power accumulation or something which I can explain. This has meant that I have now plugged my speakers back into my MBP and the problem is solved, but it means an extra cord on the desk which is what this is meant to rid me of. Overall it works really well, just a couple of annoying "habits"
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it says it does. I really ...
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it says it does. I really appreciate having all the extra high speed USB 3.0 ports for my Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gernhardt

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hassle or money
customer_reviews.text: Having major issues after using for 1 month. It will disconnect itself which shuts down everything and then I need to start over. Would NOT recommend purchasing this item.
customer_reviews.author: Dachshund Lover

customer_reviews.title: But great company so I would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Very pricey and one of the USB ports just stopped working. But great company so I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Adgar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: WOW, this thing smokes. it does everything that I need with room to grow. Easy to set up, transport.
customer_reviews.author: Coachwhip

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid
customer_reviews.text: Rock solid, no connectivity issues or drop outs as yet. Style matches the iMac very well
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Worked great right out of the box. Helps organize space in a 2 monitor 15 HD setting
customer_reviews.author: DavidMcL

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks - a little expensive but it really works so no problem!
customer_reviews.author: Francis P Catrine

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Better than competitors, but I do wish it came with a Thunderbolt cable.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Good, but missing a Key Directive
customer_reviews.text: Looks sharp. Lots of ports. Lacking one important directive... And that is... what those of us who use an external speaker system need to do to get the audio channeled correctly through IT. In my opinion, this should be in a big, screaming banner somewhere. When I called OWC directly, they quickly explained how to do it -- a simple VERY task. They have excellent customer service, but on this simple issue, they could eliminate the need to call them and major frustration by just including this one Key Directive. Other than that, this is a 'plug and play' device.
customer_reviews.author: TheSunKid

customer_reviews.title: Nice Thunderbolt 2 dock
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent docking solution for Apple branded computers with Thunderbolt 2 ports. It offers a wide range of ports including Firewire. The power outputs are also very satisfactory. The only obvious downside is that it doesn't come with a Thunderbolt cable.
customer_reviews.author: Ozay

customer_reviews.title: It's working fine
customer_reviews.text: Really useful for connecting a lot of USB devices to my iMac. No trouble until now!
customer_reviews.author: Sorin

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to test before return time expires
customer_reviews.text: Simply didn't work with my 2015 11 inch Macbook Air. I tried with all different sorts of cables and combinations, but the connection to the monitors and external hard drives continuously disconnects.
customer_reviews.author: David Sasaki

customer_reviews.title: Five stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. OWC always delivers and can be considered a go-to source for computer needs. This particular dock is also very elegant and sits perfectly next to Mac Pro workstations or laptops. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Discriminating Tastes

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This dock doesn't work properly. Signal drops out and makes monitors re-sync many times a day. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo A Celis

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised. Has the ports I wanted, ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Has the ports I wanted, at a price that beat everyone else. It has quietly receded into the background of my technical life, which is exactly what I was hoping for. Got rid of much of my tangle'd mess.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Brown

customer_reviews.title: great dock, iPhone and iPad my cause some interference if they are too close.
customer_reviews.text: I have had the OWC Thunderbolt 2 Dock for about a year now. It has been reliable and has made my desktop a bit cleaner. The only problem I have had with it, was the screen black and it going "off line". I finally figured out that If my iPhone or iPad are too near the dock and I get an incoming call or text message. it caused the Dock to reset. Pretty much it has to be close enough like setting on it or touching it. Other wise it has been flawless. Just took a while to trouble shoot the interference. (Right before it goes black the image on the monitor will shift ether to the right or left.)
customer_reviews.author: Roger Mamer

customer_reviews.title: Just connect it to power, & plug in all ...
customer_reviews.text: Just connect it to power, & plug in all your external devices. It just works. I can now access my Firewire 800 external drives.
customer_reviews.author: jsprout3

customer_reviews.title: Everything but the Ethernet port works
customer_reviews.text: I like that I don't have to disconnect a bunch of wires from my Macbook Air when I want to run out the door with it. The only issue I've had for 13 months, which I finally figured out today, is that the ethernet port just doesn't work. I have to plug the ethernet cable into a mini adapter that uses one of the thunderbolt ports. Now I am direct wired instead of WiFi. Other than that, I love this.
customer_reviews.author: Sandie H

customer_reviews.title: This is handy for hot-docking my Mac to my thunderbolt ...
customer_reviews.text: This is handy for hot-docking my Mac to my thunderbolt displays and DasKeyboard. Doing this before directly to the Mac with all my devices plugged into the displays directly was problematic and would often take a reboot to get the screens to recognize. Plus this minimizes the problem of the Apple Thunderbolt displays' cables which are toooooooo short.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip G

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Such a great dock. Thunderbolt works great. Design accents my iMac an Lacie drives well.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Gomez

customer_reviews.title: All-in-one Perfection.
customer_reviews.text: With the demise of the Apple Thunderbolt Display, my new job sent me a Dell monitor. The Thunderbolt 2 Dock provides the convenience of one cable for everything with even more expansion, flexibility and support options than my coworker's display. I hope to get another one for my personal laptop/workspace.
customer_reviews.author: Oculus

customer_reviews.title: should include a cable, but great otherwise
customer_reviews.text: This product works as advertised. I would give it 5 stars if they shipped with a thunderbolt cable. If they need to charge an extra 20 dollars so they can include the cable that would be better.
customer_reviews.author: John buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great! I'm able to expand my macbook pro with just one thunderbolt cable.
customer_reviews.author: enrique

customer_reviews.title: Not as powerful as one would hope.
customer_reviews.text: Some of the inputs/outputs don't provide the type of power to devices one would expect.
customer_reviews.author: VIKING K. WHITE

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised. Did not want to invest in expensive Thunderbolt Display.
customer_reviews.author: Thierry J. Braham

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The device is faulty and so it was of no use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I expected it to handle two monitors. one Displayport and one HDMI but it didn't
customer_reviews.author: William Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Works right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Product work perfect for my video and Ian 3 and FireWire needs but what I thought was a scratched up used unit was a very thin coat of plastic that you can't tell is plastic. Before you send it back pull the plastic off don't do like I did, lol
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: It does work with Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: Great product. It DOES work with windows. I have a 5K iMac running windows 10. So far the usb ports see my iPhone, flash drives, and the apple super drive. Not sure if the other ports work.
customer_reviews.author: mrrjm

customer_reviews.title: Returned after 1 day.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to connect my iMac, Macbook Pro to each other and to an external drive. It connected once for about ten minutes and then wouldn't connect again. I returned it the next day. Not sure what the problem was but I'm not into buying new equipment and then troubleshooting it. I just expect it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Dkempner

customer_reviews.title: I recommend that Amazon refrain from using disreputable vendors
customer_reviews.text: Ethernet port was DOA. The unit appears to have been previously returned. I found dirt on the rubber feet. The bottom protective plastic cover had be partially removed and then replaced. Top protective plastic cover was scratched. I recommend that Amazon refrain from using disreputable vendors.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Lee Probasco

customer_reviews.title: Weak Sauce
customer_reviews.text: This cord provides such a flimsy connection and requires tweaking most everyday. I should have opted for a strip of tinfoil...or maybe a bit of duct tape!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Forbes

customer_reviews.title: Great item and loving the legacy Firewire800
customer_reviews.text: This dock was so needed for my MacBookPro Late 2014 as every port was in use all the time and I had to connect and reconnect every time I would need to use the laptop on the go. Every port of the dock is now in use, seemlessly... Make sure your power saving settings are turned off. Great item and loving the legacy Firewire800
customer_reviews.author: Martin Renaud

customer_reviews.title: Get the Cal Digit instead!
customer_reviews.text: Why so many useless FW800 ports? Very stupid design. Had they given use eSatas instead of Firewires, I'd say go for it.
customer_reviews.author: D.dot.C.dot

customer_reviews.title: Want to Plug in a Lot of Things Into Your Thunderbolt Port?
customer_reviews.text: Use this thing. I can plug a bunch of stuff into it. There are two charging USB ports on the side. It works. Everything works. Make sure to grab the update to make the USB charge ports recognizable by your mac as 5V charge ports.
customer_reviews.author: D David

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  No issues
customer_reviews.text: I use it everyday. It drives an HDMI monitor and has wired Ethernet and a USB printer. Works great. No issues
customer_reviews.author: Commercialphoto32

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product, and great service from Amazon when the ethernet port on the first unit that arrived didn't work. The replacement worked perfectly and this product completed a new installation for my wife with her old VGA monitor and her new MacBook Air.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool for a Mac. disappointing for PC: because they did not develop a driver for PC use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Works just as described. Has greatly simplified my life. Have noticed no problems.
customer_reviews.author: DARIO M

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good product but overpriced for what it is but there are not many other choices out there.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wish this product came with a Thunderbolt Cable. You will need to purchase that separately.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H.
